reviewText: It's too bad Amazon doesn't seem to be carrying this anymore, but you can get it directly from ProMix.  At $16 a pound for grass-fed protein, minimally processed, and without much by way of additives, it's an excellent value.  It dissolves very easily in a shaker bottle and mixes great in a blender as well.I sweeten my protein shakes with SweetLeav stevia drops.  I like having that control over the flavor profile, so I appreciate that this is unflavored.

Big horse pills. Don't think they work, or help much. probably a 1% fat burning increase (not).  If your cutting and trying to lose weight why not add a little placebo or enjoyment in thinking this pill will do magic. It was only 9.99 when i bought it. I'd say its more psychological than any real benefit. good to get into a routine. take pills, diet, exercise, pills did it all!!  NOW IM RIPPED!!!!
summary: Supplements help you keep you strict

reviewText: If you have GERD or chronic heartburn, take ginger. Don't waste your money on expensive prescriptions. This stuff works even better.

I have used this on several things, especially the crud left after removing masking tape or duct tape.  It really does work.  It's not greasy like WD40, so you can also use it for clothing stains, and other places where a really heavyduty stain remover is needed.  I would recommend it.

I started shaving in 1988 with the Slim Twin Cartridge razor (the same year it was released), and continued using it even when they discontinued the cartridges and just made the disposables, finally switching to these when the stores sold out of cartridges. I don't know why but I've never really got along with three or more blade razors, they either irritated my skin, were too bulky, or missed hairs. These do none of that, they're gentle on my face and because of the slim head I can maneuver in to get every single little hair (even works on my unibrow). The push cleaning also makes these impossible to clog.But they're best attribute is the price on Amazon of just 64 cents a razor, and since each one is good for about a week you only spend 10 cents a day on blades to shave. Pretty much the only way to shave cheaper is to use a double edge razor, and even then you don't save that much more.By the way occasionally you'll order these and receive three 12+3 free packs, and then they're an even better deal
summary: Best Twin Blade Disposable on the Market.

reviewText: This is a quality product from a trusted brand.  These are very handy when you have toddlers around.  The wipes smell good, yet they still have that sting to them that most disinfectants do.  These wipes are thick and easy to grasp and pull from the canister.  They have good cleaning power too, you don't have to scrub very hard if you are wiping up a stuck on spill.  Highly recommend over using plain paper towels.

The tape has excellent adhesive strength and is good for using along with a gauze pad on larger areas of the body.The reason I deducted 1 star is that caution should be exercised on delicate or sensitive skin, since abrasions could occur when removing the tape.  It would be best to test a small area before applying to make certain it will not later be too painful to remove.The adhesive quality is definitely stronger than that of a band-aid.  That could be a good, as well as a bad, characteristic depending on the area of the body it's needed for.
summary: 3M Medipore soft cloth surgical tape-4in. wide

reviewText: After reading so many positive reviews on this product I decided to give it a try.  I have had gout for over 10 years now and there are times when I cannot stand or put any weight on my foot during a flare up and the pain is immense.When I initially started using this product, I did notice I felt better, however after a few days I started to get pains in my chest/abdomen after taking these pills.  I am not sure if I am just too sensitive or something, but it no longer makes my feet feel any better or anything.  I have even tried taking 2 - 3 pills at once like some people on here have mentioned, and still no relief.I am not saying this product does not work, just saying it doesn't work for me (at least not after the initial usage).
summary: May work for some, but not for me...

reviewText: I have an issue with occasional itching around certain times of the month so I thought I would give this a try.  It arrived during a time most needed for the reasons in which the product is marketed.  Its working better than my normal bodywash so for any improvement I am grateful.  But, I will say that the bodywash I was using was scented and this may have been part of the problem.  I am pleased with the scent of this Poise product.  It is very subtle so it has not been irritating to my more delicate parts.  I do not have a general issue with sensitivity or allergies so this formulation has worked fine for me.

Wow, I've had this for less than a week and I have lovely smooth underarms (ouch, ouch, ouch) for the first time in many years.  My legs are pretty smooth, but haven't grown out enough yet, but I can shave my underarms and in two hours have a "five oclock shadow".  Allowing two days growth, I tried this last night (it took about three different times) and now, I should be able to go bare for the rest of the season.  My legs didn't hurt much, but I don't have the density there that I do under my arms, and the two days growth isn't enough for a leg test yet.Since the calf area really didn't hurt, I was thinking maybe it was just cutting the hairs, but when you remove the cover, you can see all the little hairs which have been ripped out by the roots!  Yucky, but gratifying.If you've waxed before, you will find this to be a boon.  It works on those pesky little chin hairs that crop up after ladies reach 35 or so, and I thought that would be a daily job for the rest of my life!Take a couple of pain relievers an hour before hand and maybe apply some ice for a few minutes if you are really sensitive.  It is a great product and I'll be recommending it to my friends.

I had my husband try out this shaver and compare to the Norelco I bought him for Christmas.What he liked:  Close shave, ergonomic grip, good battery life, looks coolWhat he didn't like:  no pop up trimmer, pulls when used dry, charging stand instead of power cordMy husband has no particular interest in shaving in the shower so that feature isn't something he's used.  Some have mentioned that helps minimize discomfort when shaving but he is "old skool" and can't be convinced to take an electric appliance into the shower!  Also, the charging stand kinda bugs me.  It would lead you to believe the razor should be stored in the stand in between uses, plugged in and draining power.  Can't imagine why you'd need this with a lithium powered device that's going to hold a charge for a week or two.  I'd rather have a regular power cord we could stash in a drawer most of the time.The Remington shaver is currently selling for $20 more than the Norelco PT730 which comes with a pop up trimmer.  Unless shaving in the shower is of the utmost importance to you, I'd go with the Norelco.
summary: Better if it had a pop up trimmer

reviewText: I've tried them all over the years but Gain is still the one I like the best.  It makes my clothes smell good and gets them clean...what more can I ask for?

This seems to be a very good product. I bought it to hopefully keep me from getting sea sick on an upcoming cruise because I struggle with motion sickness and dizziness.  I have started taking it about 2 weeks prior and I have noticed that I definitely feel better over all. Seems like I don't get dizzy spells as much and I just feel more energy and even less pain in general(I have fibromyalgia). I would recommend to anyone who has chronic pain, low energy (chronic fatigue syndrome) dizziness, or even stomach issues! I think I am even going to have my kids start taking it daily because one has allergies & asthma (ginger is supposed to help w/ inflammation) and the other has stomach issues. I will update my review after I get back from the cruise to say if it helped with sea sickness or not.
summary: I would recommend to anyone with health issues!

reviewText: I take this like I used to take TUMS, only not nearly so often.  Never liked licorice, but you have to do what you have to do.  Also used D-Limonene and Mastic.  But once I began these products the GERD got a lot better and I only used them when GERD is an issue, several times a week, but not daily.  For GERD there is also an interesting jumping exercise if the GERD is caused by the stomach herniating through the diaphragm.  Drink a glass of room temperature water before breakfast, then jump ten times landing on your heels--not too high.  ASK YOUR DOCTOR FIRST.  The weight in the tummy pulls the esophagus down through the diaphragm.  This was helping even before I got the pills.  Doesn't get five stars because I still have occasional GERD.  Elevate your bed and sleep on your right side.

I bought this for my brother, who lives in Florida. He really appreciated it and thought the assortment of stuff inside this handy pack was great. I spent quite a bit of time comparing different emergency packs, and this one does seem to be the best deal for the money. Hopefully he'll never have to use it, but it's good peace of mind for a decent price. I added a few items that I thought it needed, including a multi tool knife, an emergency radio/flashlight combo, and some other stuff. You can get ideas from emergency preparedness web sites.

These are a really thought through product. I love that all the writing is done on the top part so the ink can't come into contact with the milk. The heavy duty ziplock has never failed me. The sides have a half circle shape that is perfect for pouring the bottle into, so I've never spilled milk pouring it in. The milk pours back out of the sides just as easily. I would recommend laying these flat before freezing because it will save you freezer space and it is much easier to thaw out the milk. I tried freezing milk in little bottles and it took FOREVER to thaw the milk which is not helpful when your baby thinks she is starving. These thaw out pretty quickly. I did not notice a plastic smell to the milk after thawing like others mentioned. My baby has not ever denied milk that has been frozen and thawed in these either. She has denied milk that was a few days old in the fridge though.

The idea behind disposable toilet scrubbers is fantastic, but I couldn't get past the environmental impact of those deadly chemicals and all that disposable waste. When I saw that the Clorox wand would only work with Clorox brushes, I scoped out a wand that would allow me to attach my own alternative. Scrubbing Bubbles was it. I can clip in old sponges, folded old rags, folded paper towel, etc, and I use whatever earth-friendly cleaners I like. So I really just bought this for the wand.
summary: Love the idea, but what about the environment?

reviewText: The Philips Norelco AT830 PowerTouch is the best electric razor my husband has ever used.  It actually gives him a shave that is "blade close".  He keeps the razor and charger in the car and uses it on the go.  The battery is long lasting and charges up quickly.  The blades, while providing a close shave, are not irritating to the skin, even on the neck area. He highly recommends The Philips Norelco AT830 PowerTouch razor.
summary: The blades, while providing a close shave, are not irritating to the skin, even on the neck area.

reviewText: I've used a lot of Garcinia Cambogia extracts and have enjoyed results.  My initial results with this product are similar to others I have tried that I have liked.  This is a good addition to a healthy diet and exercise.

reviewerName: Andrew Chang: 7-Hour School Week and Health, ...
reviewText: Glutamine is the most essential amino acid that you must supplement into the Window of Opportunity post-workout shake. Glutamine is amazing for enhancing protein synthesis and decreasing oxidative stress and catabolism. I use the ON Powder of Glutamine and just put it in my mouth with the post-workout shake. This prevents lost of any potency.I follow ABC bodybuilding's article on the Window of Opportunity.Everyone should read this article and use this formula. This is the best guideline on essential supplementation.Please keep in mind that it is a guide, not a dogma. Do what feels right and what works for you.The Window of Opportunity is a post-workout shake that I used when I put on over 30 pounds of muscle within 3 months. My bench went from 215 pounds to 450, body fat from 7% to 3%, and mile time from 6 minutes to 5. It works.Here are the quick basics, although you definitely must read the article yourself.After the work out, you should consume .22 gram of protein per pound of bodyweight and 5 grams of carbohydrate (half dextrose, half maltodextrin) per 10 pounds of lean muscle mass for bulking, or 2.5 grams of carbohydrate (half dextrose, half maltodextrin) per 10 pounds of lean muscle mass for cutting.You should also consume 5-10 grams of creatine, 5-10 grams of glutamine, and a multi-anti-oxidant formula. All this must be done over a 45-60 minute period.The 45-60 minute sequence is vital:Step One:Blend 1/3 protein (experiment to find the exact number for you), 1/3 dextrose (simple sugar), and 1/3 maltodextrin (complex sugar) with enough water (water should be at least 92% of the total mixture). Add 500 mg of sodium per liter of water used.Shake the ingredients well. Put creatine powder in your mouth (5-10 grams when starting, 2.5-5 grams once body is saturated with creatine) and drink the shake to wash the creatine down. It is better to do this than to mix the creatine in water, as that makes creatine lose its potency.Drink one half of the shake within 5 minutes of working out. After this 5 minutes, allow an additional 10-15 minutes for the solution to settle in your stomach.Step 2:After the solution has dissolved in your stomach for 10-15 minutes, consume 5-10 grams of Glutamine and your multi-vitamin with one gulp of the shake.Continue to drink the remaining half of the shake for the following 30-45 minute period.It is vital to drink small sips of your shake for the entire 30-45 minute period. This allows for maximum absorption rate of the nutrients into your body.
summary: I Put on 30 Pounds of Muscle in 3 Months Because of Glutamine

reviewText: This toothpaste is NOT as "minty" as I usually prefer, and it seems to taste of old cans.  It is also quite a bit "grittier" than I want a toothpaste to be.  There is very little foaming as one brushes.  I will not be purchasing this product again.
summary: Odd taste, lots of grit, no foam

reviewText: A normal sized clear capsule, Pomguard is easy to swallow, doesn't smell strange, leaves no after taste and has none of the awful and sometimes dangerous side effects of pharmaceuticals.I decided to try this supplement when my last check-up showed that my cholesterol was beginning to head in the wrong direction and I didn't want to take prescription medications to lower cholesterol because of the awful side effects other family members have suffered from taking Statins.As with any supplement, until I see my Physician for blood tests, I will not be able to tell if this has had any positive effects but I will keep taking it in the hopes that it will help lower my cholesterol and with all the anti-oxidants Pomegranate is known to contain it certainly can't hurt to try.

reviewerName: Trevor L "God is on the side of the army with...
reviewText: I work out at the gym a few days a week and I prefer something a little stronger to put on.  Usually heavy sweating wears through the antiperspirant smell. Not so with Speed Stick.

I mix this oil for cleaning with white distilled vinegar on a sponge and wipe down my surfaces. After, I drop some in the sink and the smell lasts forever. I smell lemon more than most of the other oils blended in and it's just fine by me. Great product for those of us who don't want a chemically bleachy smell after cleaning. use it on floors,toilets and anything else you like.

We needed some 9 volt batteries for a garage door opener and for a piece of camera equipment.  My wife picked up a generic brand that was just cheap to give them a try.  Like most things, when you buy cheap you get cheap.  The batteries were about  power and they were still two years within the expiration date.We picked up a set of these Energizer batteries and the quality and charge level is well worth the difference in price.  You just can't beat Energizer for alkaline batteries and quality.  For us we are through testing off brands and from now on no more wasting money.  It is Energizer only for us!I posted a photo of the pack we got with an expiration date in 2018.

reviewText: Taking it for 10 weeks. Working slowly I guess. One inch less stomach, no weight loss. No weight gain. I'd say don't buy it, well try it but prepare to use it 3 months before judgeing it. I've tried several things Dr. Oz has recommended, so far zero.

I love this stuff although I think they have diluted the formula over the years. I still find it to be the best for removing visible flaky skin anywhere on my body in an emergency. reviewText: This thing is exactly what I needed, it makes contact with my the entire lower back and it stays cold for hours.

My wife reminds me that I'm getting old. She pointed out that I was loosing hair where I should have it and growing hair where I shouldn't have it. This makes it easy to take care of the hair in the areas where it shouldn't be growing, yet it doesn't do anything to bring back the hair that is falling out where it should be growing.

I love that I can stock up on mouthwash on amazon and I don't have to worry about running out and forgetting it at the store. I used ACT when I was growing up, so I trust it. The flavor is not as good as scope, but it does the job.

Old Spice, for a few months, used to offer "prescription strength" Anti-Perspirant which was great for me because not only did it smell great, but it WORKED! reviewText: The picture looked really promising, the real product is a bit less.As the picture shows there are 4 swiveling heads that are massaging your body.Even though on the box it seems like you can use this product for any part of your body, it's really not that easy and comfortable.We mostly use it for our back, mainly lower back since it's no high enough to reach our upper back when we sit on the sofa.The features I do like about this product are :1) The heating: really adds, and makes the massage feel a bit better.2) The portability, you can rotate it, take it from room to room etc. Nice!Other than that, it's just a fair basic massage tool, don't expect it to replace a real massage.

I love this skin care line., it has changed my life. I really love how this cream absorbs into my skin and leaves a slight youthful dewy sheen before bedtime. It has made my skin so soft and less crinkly.
This is to HOT!!!  Even on 'warm', it is to hot.  I would recommend youbuy something else.  Maybe with  a slidable switch?  I still haven't figuredout 'auto off' light, as it never comes on.

I purchased these for use in my tactical flashlight and I chose these because their overall rating was good for the price of the batteries.  I have not been disappointed.  They work well, last a long time and I have not had a problem with them.I recommend this product!
summary: for the money, these are good batteries...

reviewText: OK, so I've had Brazilian waxes occasionally over the years.  So painful.  But love the results.  What I did was had a Brazilian 3 weeks ago.  Bought this particular wax after reading consistently great reviews.It's a great product.  Simple directions.  Watch YouTube video first, and it'll be really clear how to apply.  Make sure, since the wax melts from the middle of jar first, to stir it to honey-like consistency.  Apply just very small areas, one by one so it's not too painful.  I applied about 2 1/2" x 1" strips on face (first time every doing face - just have some peach fuzz...).  GREAT results - left no redness which surprised me.  Looks so clean and fresh now.RE:  Brazilian... it's SO much easier, less painful if you have a professional one done first, and then keep up on it at home with this brand of wax (seller great -super fast shipping and the 2 jars I ordered were packaged tightly and perfectly).  If you're using your home waxing to simply keep up/maintain after a professional Brazilian, it's super cost-effective and so much less pain because the hair is softer and more sparse -  and as long as you take care of it every few weeks, it's inexpensive, simple and works beautifully!  Saves a ton of money and not difficult at all - it's really a lot of simple common sense!Will buy this particular product from here on out.  I'm done with $65 waxing jobs.  So glad I found this!
summary: Best waxing (brazilian, facial, etc) - very pleased!!

reviewText: These are great wipes that do not have a harsh chemical smell.  The "natural" smell takes somewhat getting used to if you're used to clorox wipes and such.  But they're worth it. I also like that they're a disinfecctant and not just a wipe--killing the germs is what I'm after!  I use these mainly to clean bird dropping....gross, but that's life when you have pet birds.

For the money there isn't a more simple, user-friendly ovulation tester on the market.  It's the same test that is used at fertility clinics.  It's accurate, easy to use, easy to read (smiley face means you're ovulating, which is pretty accurate, in my opinion, since most people who are testing for ovulation are supposed to be happy when they are, in fact, ovulating), and comes from a trusted name brand.

It is very soft and I believe it's a little too soft for me because I found that my jaw was a little sore the 2nd night I used it.  I guess I had been grinding my teeth. reviewText: The concept is good, but they slide around, so the usefulness is pretty much lost for that reason.  If you put them UNDER your socks, they work better, but I wouldn't recommend these.

The Diurex Max is really very effective.  It's my wife who uses it and has done so for a long time.  It really helps her a lot and she uses it in conjunction with her high blood pressure medications.  It seriously really does make a significant difference for her.

The green and blue ones were recommended to me by my podiatrist after I came in with the complaint of not being able to fully bend my big toe.  I found a local store and ended up with the green ones since they seemed to have a much stiffer toe area than any of the other insoles.  The arch is perfect for me and size C fit perfectly into my size 8 sneakers.I read through all of the bad reviews for these and most of the people who gave this product one star totally had the wrong size or picked the wrong arch support.  Your feet shouldn't hang over these or feel pinched, and they shouldn't make any noise.  The green ones are also not what I'd call a "soft" insole.  They kinda remind me of how a tennis ball feels.  Firm, but with a very slight squish to them.  Firm is exactly what I need to keep my big toe supported so I can put off surgery, so these are perfect for me.
summary: Perfect for hallux limitus when you have a high arch

reviewText: After a single use my washer definitely looks brighter and smells cleaner.  I'm giving this 4 stars only because I can't attest to how the product will do with heavy residue (since my washer didn't have any).  The only place I seem to get residue is on the top of the tub (above the water line), and this product didn't help with that, but I wouldn't have expected it to work above the water line.  For a general freshening this seemed to work great and it smells fantastic, too!

I take a couple of products for a natural approach to my high blood pressure.  A diuretic like this is for most people a fundamental for a non prescription approach to high BP.  This Vita Heart brand does work pretty good in ridding one of fluid and sodium that very much affects ones BP.  Unfortunately there are certain products on Amazon that do not offer a discount in shipping for multiple units.  This is one of them.  The base price of this per package is quite reasonable.  Unfortunately its all rather lost if you order multiple units for the shipping is multiplied by the same price price per unit every time you add another to the order.  That makes it pretty expensive compared to some other diuretics available on Amazon.The bottom line on this stuff is that it has worked for me in the past quite well.  However I have used other diuretics that either cost less or come with a discount on shipping for multiple units that work just as good.  I would do some research first and try a cheaper brand, or one that offers a shipping discount before trying this... : )Update:  As of July, 2013, this supplement now ships with the shipping price that stays the same, or changes very little with each ordered.  Definitely good stuff and a deal this way, but keep an eye on it.  If it changes back to no discount for shipping its not worth it...
summary: Works Ok But No Discount On Shipping.  (See Update)

reviewText: This machine is great.  It works just like some of the high priced machines you see in the doctor's office.  I love that you can use batteries, but it also comes with an adaptor so you can plug it in.
The Blades are top quality at a very affordable price.  I tried at least 20 brands and these ranked in the top tier.

Took two capsules per day faithfully for two months of Garcinia Cambogia.I notice some benefit, that the capsules did slightly suppress my appetite.And I felt a slight improvement in mood and outlook.But since I didn't also exercise ~ my weight loss was very little (2-3 lb).That's likely why it says at the end of the company's product statement.> The effect of Garcina is seen best with balanced diet and regular exercise <So while this is a good product ~ it's not a 'do nothing different',miraculous answer for weight loss.That being said ~ I feel this is a worth while product when coupled with exercise,and it also has some healthful benefits ~ contains 60 mg calcium & 75 mg potassium.I didn't have any issues taking the capsules, and they didn't upset my stomach.Usage ~ Take one capsule two times daily 30 minutes before meals with 6 oz of water.PRODUCT STATEMENT OF HOW IT'S SUPPOSED TO WORK ~The HCA extracted from Garcinia Cambogia aids in weight loss by doing two things:1. It helps to block fat, and it suppresses your appetite.HCA blocks fat by inhibiting a key enzyme that your body needed to make fatfrom carbohydrates: Citrate lyase.2. HCA also suppresses appetite by increasing level of Serotonin, a neurotransmitterin your brain that makes you feel good.By increasing serotonin levels, HCA improves mood and suppresses the drive to reactto stressful situations with food.As you eat less, your body senses this and it releases stored fat in your fat cells.So it inhibit the Formation of New Fat from Food, and force Body to utilize energy from Existing Fat.The Effect of Garcina is Seen Best with Balanced Diet and Regular Exercise.Garcinia Cambogia doesn't contain any ~ fillers ~ additives ~ artificial ingredients.The capsules are ~ halal and kosher ~ certified veggie capsules.Made in U.S.A.

My dental hygienist has often suggested that I use an electric toothbrush, but I never did. I'm glad I had the opportunity to try this one out.The batteries were easy to install. The toothbrush is not too bulky or heavy.My teeth definitely feel cleaner after using this toothbrush. It runs automatically for 2 minutes, and I have learned that I had been brushing my teeth far shorter than 2 minutes! I'm still working up to it.The one drawback would be that I also brush my tongue, but even with the toothbrush turned off, I don't feel as effective in that area, because of the smaller head. This is not as small as some of the electric toothbrushes I've seen, but it is much more narrow than a standard toothbrush.
summary: My first electric toothbrush -- I'm a convert!

I bought this on a whim and I’m very pleased. I was especially impressed by what you get, considering the price I paid. First thing that caught my attention was that it came in a soft gel form. Soft gels are generally better absorbed than tablets, and in my experience, are easier on the stomach. These soft gels come encapsulated in flax seed oil - this also helps with absorption, as certain fat soluble vitamins need a fat in order to be absorbed and this minimizes the need to take them with a meal that contains some fats. Also, they are twice a day, which is also better than the more popular one a day forms. Some people might find having to take them twice a day inconvenient, but if you are going for optimal absorption, you need to split vitamins up throughout the day as the body can only absorb a certain amount at a time, and if you are taking it once a day a portion of that is not going to get absorbed, unless you don’t mind breaking them in half.Also noteworthy is this Multi provides superior forms of each vitamin- meaning they clinically proven to be more bioavailable to the human body than their synthetic counterparts, e.g. Eve gives you vitamin A in beta carotene form, Vit. D as cholecalciferol, vitamin E as alpha tocopherol. The amounts of some are a little high but nothing to cause concern - RDA guidelines are always way lower than need be - and much more of a concern if the fat soluble vitamins are in a synthetic form.Some people have commented these are large - which they are- but these the soft gels have a smooth coating, so they go down fairly easy with a glass of water.OveraIl I think this is very good vitamin. Not elite, but grades above many of the multis out there on the market.
summary: Very Good Vitamin for a Great Price

Ordered this for my wife after doing a little reading on epilators.  She had one years ago that was pure torture, never could figure out why anyone would use one for all the hassle and pain, a razor surely would have been faster and without the misery.I found that the original models used a rotating curved spring.  When you curve a spring the opening on the inside of the curve becomes very narrow to closed, while the spring on the outside is wider, this spring would rotate grabbing hair on the open side and while spinning the narrow side would grab the hair and pull it out.  Often the spring would break and have to be replaced.  This model uses spinning discs across the surface, two discs operate together slightly angled as to form a V between them.  The open part of the discs go over the hair pulling it into the closed section and remove the hair.  This unit has two speed settings, soft and fast, so you are able to select which is most comfortable.  Epilating is similar to getting waxed for hair removal.  The advantages of this unit are rather obvious if you have ever subjected your self to one of the original models.  You had to plug the unit into a wall socket which limited where you could use it.  This is rechargeable, so it can be used anywhere including the shower, it is quiet and the discomfort is far less.  In fact, my wife said she could not believe the difference.  If you use this routinely you hardly feel anything after the first or second time.  This model is probably one of the best you can purchase, the quality is there and included are five heads and caps for different areas of the body along with 16 Olay wipes. I'm glad that I got this for her, she is happy with it and is really pleased with the results.Just had to go through this in case you have had the same experience with one of the old hay balers---no comparison.
summary: Not At All Like The First Epilators

I recently bought aWahl Groomsman, which is a compact sized groomer, with a nice set of attachments and accessories.  One thing the Wahl didn't have however, was a nostril hair trimmer, so when this Philips Norelco groomer went on sale for $10, I decided to get it, mostly because it does have a nostril hair trimmer.  I didn't really need another grooming set, but paying only $10 for a nostril hair trimmer, didn't seem that outrageous.The first thing I noticed, was that the Norelco motor makes a lot more noise, when compared to the Wahl, which makes a low humming sound.  The Norelco motor is raspy, and it sounds like there is a lot of friction.  Strangely, while the quieter Wahl comes with a bottle of machine oil, Norelco claims that their groomer requires no lubrication.  It's not the most pleasant experience, sticking a noisy nostril trimmer into your nose, and it gets hot pretty fast, but it does a decent job.Besides the nostril hair trimmer, the Norelco has attachment heads for a hair clipper, a precision clipper, and a mini-shaver, with clip on combs for hair, moustaches, and beards.  These seem a bit oversized, but work pretty well, although the spacing between the comb teeth is rather wide.  While Norelco provides 2 comb attachments and a carrying pouch, the Wahl set comes with 7 assorted combs, and a zippered bag.At only about 0.6" wide, the mini-shaver is quite small.  It works well enough, but again it's rather noisy.  The fit of some of the attachments isn't that secure.  A little too much pressure in a certain direction, and the mini-shaver, or nostril trimmer pop off.  Putting the release button immediately above the power switch, where it can accidentally be pressed, isn't a smart decision, and is another indication that workmanship and attention to detail, is just a little lacking.  The Norelco is decent grooming tool, but it's a bit rough around the edges.  Having used both products, I prefer the Wahl Groomsman, but many don't happen to agree, as the Norelco is a top seller at Amazon.  My cost of only $10, is a major factor in my 4 star rating.
summary: a decent groomer, with a noisy motor...

reviewText: Let me begin by saying that this product is an appetite suppressant. It's not a magic 'let's all lose weight fast' pill. What it does do is help you control your food intake by making you feel full. No hunger = no eating. I only wanted to lose about four to five pounds off of my belly. After the holidays I was feeling a bit too chunky and I wanted to slim down. With that being said- my mind was saying "eat eat eat" constantly. I needed that to change!I did a bit of research on A-Rx. Never heard of them prior to seeing them on Amazon, but after reading a few reviews and a few online articles I thought "Meh, why not?". I'm really happy I tried it. I prefer natural products, but for the price this one was more affordable. Within an hour of taking the first pill I felt full and for the remaining 10 hours had a normal appetite. I was no longer eating constantly- and then overeating what I did eat. I was eating normal sized portions, once or twice a day- and feeling full and happy.For the first few days I did feel some side effects. I got a bit dizzy because my body was used to taking in more calories. This isn't so much a side effect of the pill as it probably was my body telling me "You're supposed to be eating more food than this". During those times I drank some Gatorade to help rehydrate myself, ate some filling fruit (bananas mostly), and some nuts- for protein. This quick snack meal would help my  body feel like it got the nutrients it needed and the dizziness would usually subside.After a week and a half (about 10 days) I had lost my targeted 5 pounds. Most of it was belly fat, and that's what I was hoping for. It helped me take off those extra pounds that I had gained during the holidays. Had I not gotten dizzy a few times, I would have rated this five stars. But the bottom line is that this product worked for me, did what it promised, and kept me from overeating.A plus for those who are looking for natural alternatives. The ingredients only include plant extracts and vitamins.
summary: Did It's Job With Minimal Side Effects

This is a weight loss supplement that contains a blend of herbs that target four areas associated with achieving healthy weight loss: (1) Metabolism; (2) Fat Reduction; (3) Satiety and Calorie Reduction; and (4) Stress.  I took this supplement for one month along with a healthy diet (also gluten free).  I found that this supplement did noticeably lower my appetite.  However, I didn't notice any reduction in fat or loss of pounds although I did maintain a healthy weight.  As for stress reduction, this is one of those subjective measures that is hard to confirm.  I was (and still am) under a great deal of stress at work and I didn't really notice any stress reducing properties.  As for metabolism, I suspect the popular green coffee bean extract acting as a stimulant accounts for what many people consider an increase in metabolism.  I have had luck in the past with 7-Keto DHEA supplements to boost my metabolism and this supplement seemed to give me the same effect.  However, with no real loss of pounds (and I could stand to lose another 20), I guess there really wasn't much of an increase in metabolism.Like many supplements designed to promote weight loss, this one blends a lot of popular ingredients into a "super pill" that promises noticeable results.  Overall I'm not sure these pills worked for me.  In theory, the blend should be ideal for weight loss.  Truth be told, I have done better by altering my diet and watching what I eat and when.  I have increased my metabolism by factoring in some daily exercise too, and I think this is the combination that works best for me.  If you've tried weight loss supplements in the past and had positive results, there is no reason why this shouldn't give you an edge.  But I'm going to stick with what works.
summary: Interesting blend of some popular ingredients

This item is really no different than a home carpet cleaner solution that comes in a spray bottle. Sure, its a little more convenient, you just pull off the backing and place it over the stain and stomp on it to press the cleaning solution into the stain. The problem is the stain needs to be small enough to be covered by the rectangle, but large enough so as not to waste and entire pad. I am often cleaning up cat vomit stains which can be several little stains across a wide area (pet owners know that cats love to vomit as they walk!)  The first time I used it, it was on a larger cat vomit stain ( I blotted up any solids) and as directed, pressed onto pad to push cleaning solution into stain, and left overnight. The ugly brown/rust color of the stain did lift away, but my beige/gold carpeting was left with a subtle discoloration, slightly lighter area. I would definitely be very hesitant to use this on a darker color carpeting.Frankly, I will stick to Resolve in the spray bottle, which works well, as long as you patiently blot, blot, blot. Nothing special about this design.

Maybe the Oral B would be best for little kids with little teeth? MY old choppers like this bigger head. Less work, less hassle. I have read all the worry about battery life & notice mine came with instructions on how to replace them once they fail. So now I agonize on how to charge this thing. On my Oral B that lasted 20 years, it remained in the charger stand ALWAYS! Now I read to not do that, only charge when the battery is drained. So while I agonize over which path I am going to take, I will simply enjoy my new tooth brush. Which brand is best? BOTH. It's JUST a darn toothbrush for Heavens sake. I just like this one best because it's "new".
summary: No More Oral B For Me

reviewText: This Good Sense delayed release 20 mg (42 count) Omeprazole pills works well by reducing stomach acid and discomfort caused by bloating and heartburn. This drug belongs to a class of medications called the proton pump inhibitors that helps alleviate the painful and sleep disrupting Gatroesophageal Reflux disease, among other gastrological related disorders. However, OTC does not mean abuse. Stick to the instructions and check with your doctor for your long-term use. The price offered on Amazon is good when compared to other Omeprazole manufacturers.
